III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility needs to keep maintenance of the facility even though there are no
youth in the program.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• It was recommended they explore different options for a new program as they
currently don’t have any youth within their program.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
2

The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator identified the program has not had any youth for the past
nine months. She also identified a tentative plan to reopen the program within a
year. Currently the company is using the facility as a resource building to provide
virtual schooling and tutoring. The building is also being utilized for emergency
shelter, gaming, staff meeting, and various independent living skills activities. All of
these activities involve the other two programs under the Let’s Talk About It brand.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Four administration staff were interviewed. They report having no staff for the
facility at this time and will not hire any until they begin the reopening process in the
future. All four report a desire to reopen but are struggling to identify the
population/program they hope to serve.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is an older two-story home in moderate repair. The fire extinguishers are up to
date and the home is furnished appropriately. Although several of the rooms need a
fresh coat of paint, the structure is solid. All plumbing in the home is working
appropriately.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
